# accessibilityIdentifier()

**Instance Method**

Returns the accessibility element’s identity.

## Declaration

```swift
optional func accessibilityIdentifier() -> String
```

## Return Value

Returns the unique ID for the accessibility element. It is often used in automated testing.

## Discussion

This method is the getter for the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-c.protocol/accessibilityIdentifier] property.

## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityFrame()**: Returns the accessibility element’s frame in screen coordinates.
- **accessibilityParent()**: Returns the accessibility element’s parent in the accessibility hierarchy.
- **isAccessibilityFocused()**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the accessibility element has the keyboard focus.
